snippet.title: SCOTTISH CUP FINAL PREVIEW | Keeping the Ball on the Ground
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Open Goal - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

It's a big weekend in the Scottish Football calendar as we have a festive Cup Final to look ahead to as Celtic take on Andy Halliday's Hearts at Hampden Park. Will Celtic's recent upturn in form see them clinch an historic Quadruple Treble or will the Jambos add another chapter to the Hoops' so far disappointing season?

The boys also discuss another wonder display from Rangers' James Tavernier as well as Chipper's position at Hamilton, Hibs hitting form and was last weekend's Manchester Derby the worst ever?

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Jon Daly | Cup Winner w/ Dundee Utd, Signing for Rangers, Hearts Interim Role
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Open Goal - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

This week Si is joined by former big target man Jon Daly who discusses his route to Tanandice which saw him become a club legend by securing a Scottish Cup with Dundee United. 

He also discusses his move to Rangers as he became the club's first ever Irish Catholic player and he talks about some of the terrible abuse received following the move.

The big man also touches upon his coaching career with Hearts which led to him stepping in as interim manager twice before eventually having a controversial exit once new man Daniel Stendel arrived at Tynecastle.

#DundeeUnited #Rangers #Hearts

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Alex McLeish | Epic Chat on Rangers, The Scotland Job, Aberdeen Glory Days & More!
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

There's not many more illustrious careers in the game than our guest's this week as Alex McLeish chats with Si about his days as a player and manager at the top level of British and European football.

This includes stories from his days playing under Sir Alex Ferguson in his historic Aberdeen team that saw them sweep domestic honours and clinch the club's most famous victory - the European Cup Winners' Cup in 1983 vs Real Madrid.

We also discuss Alex's time in management from making his name at Motherwell and Hibs to winning 2 of Rangers' most dramatic title victories as well as a treble at Ibrox before going into detail about the ups and downs of both his spells taking charge of the Scottish National Team.

snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

All the way from Miami we're joined by former Celtic and St Mirren winger, Lewis Morgan who chats with Si on the path that led him to become the Number 7 for international superstar David Beckham's Inter Miami CF!

It's a great insight from Lewis who discusses coming through Rangers' academy as a youth player, making his breakthrough at St Mirren, thriving under manager Jack Ross, getting a huge to Glasgow giants Celtic, playing under Brendan Rodgers & Neil Lennon, starting the League Cup Final against Rangers as well as his loan experience at Sunderland which saw him feature in the infamous Netflix documentary.

snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

This week Si is joined by Derby County striker and top lad, Martyn Waghorn! 

The lads chat through Martyn’s career progression from starting out at Sunderland with Roy Keane through to establishing his senior career at Wigan & Leicester before joining Rangers during an eventful time at Ibrox.

We also touch upon his return to England where his form at Ipswich led to a huge £9 million move to current club Derby where he discusses working under Frank Lampard, Phillip Cocu and the drama of reaching the 2019 Play-Off Final.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Damien Duff | Mourinho's Chelsea, Newcastle Days, Ireland World Cup, Souness
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

What a player we've got joining us today! Premier League winner and 100-cap Irish International, Damien Duff joins Si this week to talk through the winger's illustrious career at the top level of the game.

Damien chats with us about his early start at Blackburn coming through under the likes of Kenny Dalglish, Roy Hodgson and Graeme Souness before announcing himself to the world with his stand-out display for Ireland at the 2002 World Cup in Japan & South Korea.

He also gives his take on the Roy Keane vs Mick McCarthy bust-up that kicked off in Saipan as well as discussion the other big characters he was involved with in his career at Chelsea including Ranieri and of course Jose Mourinho who he secured 2 Premier League titles with during an historic era at Stamford Bridge.

We also cover his difficult time at Newcastle, the highs of reaching the UEFA Cup Final with Fulham as well as the crazy story of his whirlwind stint at Celtic where he went from reserve team manager to on the touchline with the 1st team achieving history alongside Neil Lennon and John Kennedy.

What a career and what an interview! Enjoy!

#Chelsea #NUFC #Celtic

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Paul Lambert | Celtic Years, Dortmund Champions League Win, Cup Winner at 17
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

Si sits down with one of the best Scottish midfielders of a generation as Paul Lambert talks us through the story of his incredible career.

This discussion includes lifting the Scottish Cup at the age of only 17 with St Mirren, being a free agent with no club after leaving Motherwell to take on a mysterious offer from a Dutch agent which would go on and lead to winning the Champions League with Dortmund less than a year later!

Paul also reflects on his eventful time at Celtic where he was first tasked to help the team prevent Rangers' pursuit for 10 league titles in a row before playing a crucial role in the club's return as the dominant force in Scottish football with the arrival of Martin O'Neill which led to a historic a treble and Paul taking Celtic to a European Final as club captain.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets… Wes Foderingham | Rangers Days, Di-Canio ‘League 1 Wes’ Bust-Up
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

Former Rangers goalkeeper and Si Ferry’s ex-teammate, Wes Foderingham joins us this week for an epic and hilarious chat on the big moments from his career.

There’s some great insight from his Rangers days where he played a key part in the club’s rise to the Premiership as he discusses the team’s progress in recent years, teammates and managers including Warburton, Murty, Pedro and current gaffer Gerrard.

We also couldn’t have him on without asking about his famous on-field bust-up with Swindon manager, Paolo Di Canio when he hauled him off the pitch after 21 mins which led to Di Canio’s viral post-match interview rant about the keeper.

A right good laugh and great chat with the top man that is Wes Foderingham. Don’t miss it!

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Ronny Deila | The Story of the 4th & 5th Title of Celtic’s 9 In A Row
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE  - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

This week we’ve got a big guest joining us as former Celtic gaffer Ronny Deila chats with Si Ferry to look back on his eventful 2 years at Celtic Park.

We discuss Ronny’s route to management which saw him gain a big reputation in Norway after taking relegation battlers Stromsgodset from fighting the drop to league champions within a few years.

Ronny also describes the process of becoming Celtic manager and the early days with the squad as he attempted to revise the culture to fit his own style of play. 

Thereafter, the boys get right into the nitty gritty of Ronny’s time at the club, the highs and lows and how he reviews his place in the club’s history as the winner of 2 championships.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Clint Hill | Rangers, QPR, Mark Hughes Shambles, Warnock, Pulis & Tranmere Final
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

We've got an absolute belter for you this week with long-serving centre-half and top man, Clint Hill getting a laugh and chat with Si as we look back on the key moments of his career.

From an early career Wembley Cup Final with local side Tranmere to working his way up the divisions with Stoke and eventually long time club, QPR.

Clint discusses the different eras spent at Loftus Road with one of his favourite gaffers, Neil Warnock to the more turbulent times under Mark Hughes' Premier League side.

And we of course go into detail on Clint's season with Rangers where he established himself as a fans' favourite among the Ibrox faithful.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets… James McPake | Mad Times at Livi, Captaining Hibs, Playing and Managing Dundee
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

Current Dundee Manager, James McPake joins Si Ferry this week to take a look back on what has been an eventful career for the former centre-half which he has shared with some of the biggest characters and names in the game.

We look into the early days of his career during a tumultuous time for Livingston with ongoing financial and boardroom issues effecting the club’s progress under managers such as Richard Gough and Paul Lambert.

After chatting about his time down south with Coventry and Chris Coleman, James provides great detail and insight into his time at Hibs as captain which saw 2 Scottish Cup finals, including the infamous 5-1 defeat to arch-rivals Hearts, as well as the shock relegation under Terry Butcher.

Then of course we look at his critical time at Dundee which saw him cement himself as a pivotal figure at the club as a key player and eventual 1st team manager.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Steven Thompson | Sportscene, Tannadice, Rangers, Promotions, St Mirren Cup Winner
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

Former Scotland International & current Sportscene pundit, Steven Thompson joins Si this week in a very funny conversation to look over the striker’s career.

The chat spans his introduction to professional football with Dundee United to his ‘surreal’ time at Rangers playing alongside some of the top players in the country. We also delve into the memorable moments he had in his career down south after his initial move to Cardiff and subsequent signing for Burnley which saw him achieve promotion to the English Premier League.

And of course, we touch on the fairytale swan song which saw him become a cup winner for his boyhood team St Mirren which saw him round of his career in perfect fashion.

#Scotland #Rangers #Burnley

snippet.title: Open Goal: On the Road with Michael Stewart
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

We’re exploring Scotland’s Capital city this week as Michael Stewart picks up Si ti take a jaunt between his losing stomping grounds, Easter Road and Tynecastle.

The pair discuss Michael’s playing career which wasn’t  without its controversial moments during his time at boyhood club Hearts, arch-rivals Hibs and of course Manchester United where he played with one of the best teams the Premier League has seen.

Strap in for an enjoyable and candid chat in association with Road Safety Scotland.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Gary Mackay-Steven | Liverpool, Dundee Utd, Celtic, Aberdeen & New York
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

GMS is back in town and we took the opportunity to sit down with the winger from Thurso to chat through his career so far.

In throughly entertaining and funny conversation, GMS talks us through being at Liverpool as a young lad and training with the likes of Gerrard, Torres and Alonso.

We also go into detail on his time in Scotland where he experienced a career resurgence at Dundee United where he built his reputation as a skilful and ruthless winger which earned him his big move to Celtic where he played champions league and won titles before moving onto Aberdeen.

Gary is brilliantly candid on life as a footballer outside of the game with brilliant stories about times spent with teammates and of course there’s a certain story involving a river in there as well...

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Bobby Petta | Feyenoord, Ipswich w/ Burley, Barnes, Celtic 6-2, Ajax Game, MON
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R 

Former Celtic winger, Bobby Petta sits down with Si to talk through his career which began coming through with some of the top youth players in Holland at hometown club, Feyenoord.

Bobby tells us about his introduction to UK football when he joined the lively dressing room at Ipswich led by George Burley and containing the likes of Kieron Dyer, Matt Holland, Jason Cundy and Tony Mowbray.

And we of course got onto the Dutchman's shining moments from his career and we talk through his move to Scottish giants, Celtic where he would play a key part in some of the most defining moments of Martin O'Neill's era at the club.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Lorenzo Amoruso | Life At Rangers, Captaincy, Advocaat Fallout, Fairytale Goodbye
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

Rangers cult hero, Lorenzo Amoruso joins Simon this week to talk through his eventful 5-year spell at Ibrox which saw him arrive as a big money signing to replace outgoing 9-in-a-row captain, Richard Gough.

The big man's time wasn't without its talking points as he became one of few men to captain the club to a treble before losing the captaincy following a bust-up with manager, Dick Advocaat. He'd go onto recover and continue his position as a leader in the dressing room to eventually help the team to become treble champions once more in his final year.

It's all in there as Lorenzo is added to our long list of candid interviews with many of British football's top names!

snippet.title: Open Goal: On The Road with Shelley Kerr | #DriveSmart
snippet.description:
In Episode 3 of the Open Goal: On The Road, Si is driving from West Calder to Glasgow with Scotland Women's National Team Manager, Shelley Kerr!

Shelley tells her story as she drives Si around the old neighbourhood in West Calder before taking him along to Stirling University where she was the first woman to take control of the senior men's team. This is all on route to reaching the pinnacle of any Scotswoman's career to becoming the manager of the National Team and directing the Scotland to the historic 2019 Women's World Cup.

Sit back and enjoy!

It was a triumphant week for Scottish Clubs in Europe as both Celtic and Rangers defeated two of the top teams from Italy and Portugal and so the boys assess what’s left on the cards for the Glasgow teams in the competition.

Plus, don’t miss a special surprise guest appearing at the end of the show…

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Jimmy Nicholl | Leaving the Troubles, Man Utd, Rangers, Souness, McCoist, Coaching
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Jimmy Nicholl takes a trip down memory lane with Si Ferry, reflecting on a long career which has seen him play at the top level for the likes of Man Utd, Rangers and at two World Cups with Northern Ireland.

We also discuss his time as a coach including his famous trophy winning achievements with Raith Rovers, helping out with the national team and of course his recent tenure with Rangers.

Jimmy isn’t short of an hilarious story or two as he tells us some brilliant tales about the characters he’s shared a dressing room with over the years including George Best, Ally McCoist, Graeme Souness and Jock Wallace.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Niall McGinn | Gaelic & Derry, Life as a Celtic Player, Aberdeen, Korea, Euro 2016
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Aberdeen and Northern Ireland winger, Niall McGinn joins Si Ferry this week to discuss his career so far which has taken him from part-time football in Northern Ireland to a goal scorer for his country in one of the peak competitions in international football, Euro 2016.

Niall chats through his story along the way including signing for his boyhood heroes Celtic where he played alongside some big characters in a lively dressing room which inevitably leads to some great stories! 

The lads also review his most successful period with current club Aberdeen as they secured a historic cup win for the club under Derek McInnes as well as positioning themselves as league challengers to Celtic.

SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Si’s former teammate, Paul Caddis sits down with us this week as they look back on some of the highlights and funniest moments from the full backs career so far.

‘Caddy’ isn’t short of those stories as he reflects on some of the biggest personalities and characters he played with and under including the likes of Gordon Strachan, Paolo Di Canio, Zola, Tommy Gravesen, Artur Boruc and many more.

snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Former Celtic midfield General, Peter Grant is with Si this week as he talks us through the many highs and lows of playing with his boyhood team at Celtic Park.

From the success of his early days securing dramatic league titles and historical milestones with the club in the late 80s to Celtic’s barren years in the 90s as the team neared a financial implosion and began to fight their way back under manager and friend Tommy Burns.

The lads also discuss Peter’s time in coaching including his ill-fated return to Celtic with Tony Mowbray and his recent spell with the Scotland National Team under Alex McLeish.

snippet.title: PART 2 | A Tale of Two Games - Celtic 1 - 1 Rangers 2010
snippet.description:
Book in for a Tour at the Tennent's Story - http://www.tennentstours.com

SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

Recorded from the new Tennent’s Story museum at Wellpark Brewery, we introduce to you ‘A Tale of Two Games’ where former rivals Scott McDonald and Lee McCulloch must select and discuss their favourite games with the only rule that the game must have involved both of them.

Part 2 hands the control over to Lee McCulloch as we return to Celtic Park in the year 2010 for his choice as Rangers look to end any hopes of a Celtic comeback in the league by avoiding defeat against Tony Mowbray’s Celtic as they seek their 2nd Championship in a row.

There is plenty of significance for Scott in this game also in what would turn out to be his last game for Celtic.

snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Decorated former Aberdeen, Rangers and Leeds United full back David Robertson joins Si to discuss his trophy-laden career as well as his well highlighted period as Real Kashmir FC Manger over in the most militarised area in India!

This man has not had a quiet time in football - from coming through under Sir Alex Ferguson at Aberdeen, winning 9 in-a-row with Rangers, playing under George Graham at Leeds to now trying to organise training sessions and win football matches among a war torn area thousands of miles from home - David has a fair few stories to tell!

snippet.description:

Our latest sit down is as honest an interview you're likely to watch on the Open Goal channel as former Inverness Cale, Hearts & Rangers midfielder, Ian Black doesn't hold back as he discusses his career and the many ups and downs throughout.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Stuart McCall | Bradford, Rangers 9IAR, Funny Squad, Managing Motherwell & Rangers
snippet.description:
Stuart McCall is our guest for this week’s very candid interview as he reflects on a career that has seen many pulsating highs and some heartbreaking and emotional lows through his time with Bradford, Everton and Rangers.

Stuart has the story book out as he also recounts some of the funniest times in his career alongside the many massive characters he played with including the likes of Ally McCoist, Gazza and many others.

We of course discuss Stuart’s time in management and the success he brought to Motherwell which eventually led to the team securing a Champions League spot in the SPFL Premiership as well as getting the inside track to the difficulties he experienced during his short reign at Ibrox.

snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Former Celtic and Dundee goalkeeper, Rab Douglas is in the chair with Si this week as he chats through his career between the sticks.

In what can be an unforgiving role in a football team, Rab discusses the various highs and lows in an extraordinary career which started out playing part-time while working as a bricklayer and fireman before turning pro at 25 and then going on to win multiple honours and a place in Celtic’s team in the 2003 UEFA Cup Final.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Bob Malcolm | Rangers Youth, Advocaat, Treble, Ibrox Social Culture, 'Well & Oz
snippet.description:
Former Rangers man, Bob Malcolm joins Si this week to chat through his footballing career from doing the jobs as a young boy coming through at Ibrox to the facing challenges for his place under Advocaat and then becoming an treble winner for his boyhood club.

He also discusses life as a Rangers player during his era such as the social and drinking culture which was seen as the norm back in those days as well as the intensity of living in the Glasgow goldfish bowl as a Rangers player.

We also chat about Bob's life outside of Ibrox including his moves to Derby, Motherwell and Australia.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Robbie Savage | Life and Career In Football
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

This week we welcome one of English football's biggest personalities in recent times, Robbie Savage. 

Robbie talks with Si about his early days with the famous Class of '92 at Manchester United right through to claiming silverware with Martin O'Neill's Leicester and making himself a Premier League mainstay with the likes of Birmingham and Blackburn.

Never shy of a few ding dongs on the park, Robbie also speaks to us about all the different characters he's played with and against as well as the Managers he's played under.

snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Burton Albion winger David Templeton joins us to look back on his days in Scotland with us we go back to where it all started with Stenhousemuir straight through to becoming a fans favourite at Hearts, to scoring at Anfield and then making the trip West to join Rangers.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Joe Ledley | Cardiff, Beating the Best at Celtic, Palace & Wales Euro 2016
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Former Cardiff, Celtic, Crystal Palace & Derby midfielder Joe Ledley joins us this week to talk through his career journey so far.

Starting off as a top prospect with local side Cardiff, Joe discusses his quick trajectory into the 1st team and becoming the club’s captain at the age of 21, leading them to an FA Cup Final and a heartbreaking defeat in the play-off finals.

The boys also discuss his decision to leave Cardiff and seek to develop his career with Celtic where he would win numerous trophies and partake in one of the club’s greatest achievements in beating Barcelona.

Joe also touches on his first experiences of the Premier League with Crystal Palace and working with the likes of Sam Allardyce and Neil Warnock.

And we of course couldn’t forget to ask about Joe’s memories of Wales’ stunning performance at Euro 2016 as he looks back fondly on the amazing route which saw them reach the Semi-Finals

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Johnny Russell | Dundee United, Celtic Fan & Near Move, Derby County & Kansas
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Current Sporting Kansas star man Johnny Russell is in the hot seat this week as he and Si get a good laugh looking back on the highs and lows of the striker’s career thus far.

Johnny chats through the tough pathway to making it as a young player at Dundee United and then becoming one of the top forwards in the country. 

He also has a candid discussion about his time down at Derby County which saw him on the cusp of getting promoted to the Premier League while playing under an array of big name managers including Nigel Clough, Steve McLaren and Paul Clement.

We of course round off on how he’s now enjoying life in America as he’s now made the trip over the pond to play for MLS team Sporting Kansas.

Plenty for the boys to chew over this week as Rangers bounce back with a thumping win against Killie in the William Hill Scottish Cup with that of course not being the only talking point from the game...

We also discuss the title race as Celtic secured a crucial late win over Killie last week, the battle to avoid the drop as St Mirren and Dundee pick up results and of course everyone’s thoughts on the topic of plastic pitches in the top flight.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Mark Warburton | Life as the Rangers Manager, Brentford & Starting in the City
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

Former Rangers Manager, Mark Warburton is our guest this week as he opens up to Si on his eventful period in charge of the Ibrox club as we discuss his opening season which saw him clinch promotion to the Premiership, defeat rivals Celtic in a dramatic penalty shootout and agonisingly lose the Scottish Cup Final to Hibs in the last minute.


Furthermore, Mark goes into the different challenges he faced in his 2nd season when expectations were risen and new faces arrived as he attempted to steer the club back to a competitive level again.

Also plenty of chat from his successful time at Brentford and his pathway into football having taken an unorthodox route after working as a trader in the City for a number of years.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Paul Hartley | Romanov Era, Hearts Scottish Cup Win, Celtic 3IAR, Champions League
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - www.williamhill.com

An amazing insight into the career of one of the country’s top central midfield players in recent times as Paul Hartley candidly looks back on the big moments of his career including the explosive reign of Vladimir Romanov at Hearts which brought excitement as well as madness to Tynecastle.

Paul also speaks about his dream move to Celtic and the highlights which came from playing in the Champions League against the world’s best as well as playing a key role in the club’s comeback to clinch 3 in a row under Gordon Strachan.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Jason Scotland | Swansea, Martinez, Wigan, Dundee United & St Johnstone
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - williamhill.com

The larger than life personality that is Jason Scotland joins us for an hilarious chat through his career with loads great stories on the teams he’s played with and the characters he’s shared a dressing room with.

We go right through the Trinidad man’s time in football including his introduction to British football with Dundee United alongside mad characters like Charlie Miller and Andy McLaren, St Johnstone with Owen Coyle as well as Swansea and Wigan with Martinez. A couple of great Roy Keane stories in there also from his time at Ipswich!

The big man also looks back on one of the most famous moments for Hamilton Accies as they defeated Hibs in the Premiership play-off to reach the top flight again under Alex Neill.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Maurice Ross | Hard Graft as Rangers Youth, Advocaat, Ferguson, Winning Honours
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

William Hill | Bet £10 and Get £30 in Free Bets - williamhill.com

Si sits down with former Rangers full back, Maurice Ross as he details the intense academy upbringing under the mentorship of hard taskmasters such as John Brown and Jan Wouters which led to him becoming a Rangers 1st team player.

Once there, Maurice gives us an insight into the high demands within a Rangers squad which was littered with internationalists of the highest calibre as they went toe to toe with an equally strong Celtic team for domestic honours.

They boys also chat about Maurice’s recent career as a coach and his aspirations in that field going forward.

snippet.title: Xmas Special Part 1 | Si Ferry Meets... Heady Tennis Challenge
snippet.description:
It’s Christmas time and we’ve got a cracker of a special for you as we bring together some of our pals and former guests for the ultimate Open Goal Heady Tennis Tournament! 

Challenging for the 2018 title are former Celtic strikers Scott McDonald and Frank McAvennie as well as Rangers players Lee McCulloch and Kevin Kyle as well as Andy McLaren, Kenny Brannigan, Paul Slane and of course the main man Si Ferry.

The standard’s great, the patter questionable and we’ve got cult hero Slaney among other taking us through it on the commentary. Sit back and enjoy!

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Ryan McGowan | Hearts , Scottish Cup, Managers, Rangers Offer, Dundee Utd & Oz
snippet.description:
Great chat with Australian International and Hearts legend, Ryan McGowan as he candidly discusses his time with the Jambos from arriving in Edinburgh as a youth player to clinching one of the club’s most famous victories in the 5-1 defeat of Hibs in the Scottish Cup.

He reflects humorously on the different managers, of which there were many, and players he encountered throughout his time at Tynecastle which included a few tumultuous moments as chaos behind the scenes crept in to effect the dressing room.

There is also the topic of his proposed move to Rangers back in 2012 as he tells us how close he came to signing up for the Ibrox club.

Ryan speaks to Si on his other great pride of playing for Australia in the 2014 World Cup as well as his short spell at Dundee United.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Derek Riordan - Hibs, Celtic, Return to Easter Road and China
snippet.description:
This week we’re having a chat with one of Scotland’s most prolific strikers in recent times, Derek Riordan as he gives us a rare insight into his early glory days at Hibs as he and a group of the country’s most promising young talent were taking Easter Road by storm.

He also discusses his big move to Celtic and the difficulties that he faced while trying to become a regular in the team.

Beyond that, Derek talks us through his 2nd spell at Hibs before making a surprise move to China where he tells us about the hilarious cultural differences that he had to get used to when moving over.

snippet.description:

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Paddy McCourt
snippet.description:
This week Si sits down with one of Celtic’s most recent cult heroes, the technically gifted winger, Paddy McCourt.

Great laughs in this one as Paddy recounts his unorthodox professional career which led his pathway to the club he always supported as a boy in Glasgow. From injuries derailing his start in British Football with Rochdale to making the most of the social life back Derry and eventually the dream come true of ending up at Celtic Park. 

Hilarious stories from inside the Celtic dressing room, team nights out and of course how he managed to develop as an important first team player after getting to grips with a new level of professional training! You’ll enjoy this one!

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Ally McCoist - Scotland Special
snippet.description:
We’re buzzing as this week we welcome back one of our favourite guests to have donned the hot seat, Ally McCoist!

Ally returns to discuss his Scotland career with stories galore from his first cap to playing in various major tournaments with the country including Italia 90 and Euro 96.

The former Rangers striker also touches upon his time coaching the national team alongside Walter Smith as they set the team on their way in a dramatic Euro 2008 qualifying group.

And of course we couldn’t leave him without asking about his unconventional commentary techniques at this year’s World Cup alongside broadcasting stalwart Jon Champion!

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Stiliyan Petrov - Life and Times at Celtic, Seville, Larsson, Winning Team Spirit
snippet.description:
This week we are joined by former Celtic midfield dynamo, Stiliyan Petrov as he talks Si through his life at the club, from struggling early doors with a £6k phone bill he couldn’t pay off to becoming the heartbeat of a Celtic side that would go onto win numerous silverware and reach the Final of the UEFA Cup!

Stan is fantastically reflective on his career as he provides many humorous insights into the characters and managers he played with who drove the club to such success during his time there. 

The Bulgarian also poignantly touches on his battle with illness a few years ago and the new found appreciation of life which he enjoys and how he uses his time to help raise awareness and funds for vital research in aiding those with the same illness in which he suffered.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Simon Donnelly - Lou Macari, New Era Celtic, Stopping 10, Thistle & Dundee Utd
snippet.description:
It’s a tale of the two Simons this week as our own Mr Ferry sits down with his namesake to look back on his career as both a player and coach. 

Simon Donnelly discusses his early breakthrough with Celtic under Lou Macari during a difficult period for the club. This start kicked off an eventful career at Celtic which saw Sid play with a number of characters including the Three Amigos under Tommy Burns before eventually clinching a league title in 1998 to stop Rangers pursuit of 10 in a row.

Simon also reflects on his time as assistant manager to Jackie McNamara at Patrick Thistle and Dundee Utd including the many ups and downs that come with football management.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Barry Robson - Rangers, ICT, Dundee United, Celtic Title Win, Teammates & Strachan
snippet.description:
Enjoy this hilarious trip down memory lane with Barry Robson as he looks back on his career with Simon Ferry.

Plenty of great stories from his early days starting with Rangers through to sharing a Dundee United dressing room with the likes of Andy McLaren and Charlie Miller as well as of course going on to winning a league title and playing in the Champions League with Celtic.

Barry also discusses his experiences with Middlesbrough and going abroad to play in the MLS before returning home and achieving cup glory with Aberdeen.

Not one to be missed as Barry gives us one of the best insights into the world of football that we've had yet!

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Ian Durrant & Derek Ferguson - The Rangers Days
snippet.description:
Si sits down with two former midfield maestros and a couple of no bad patter merchants in Ian Durrant and Derek Ferguson as they discuss the good old days when both were playing for their boyhood club, Rangers.

The lads are in fine form as they reel off the stories about breaking through, the Souness days, dressing room banter and nightlife as well as addressing the rough times they experienced including one or two violent incidents on and off the pitch.

As candid an interview as you'll see with 2 Rangers legends so sit back and enjoy the laugh!

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets.. Andy McLaren - Dundee Utd & Jim McLean, Failing drugs test, Comeback & Scotland Cap
snippet.description: Si sits down with Andy McLaren to discuss the midfielder's extraordinary career ranging from hitting the heights of winning the Scottish Cup with Dundee United in 1994 to the lows of failing a drugs test after his move to Reading. Andy also talks through his recovery from his off the field issues to build up his career again at Kilmarnock to the point of achieving his first Scotland cap. You won't be disappointed with this one, there's not many a story like it!

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Stephen McManus Episode 2
snippet.description:
In Episode 2 of our sit down with Stephen McManus, the big defender starts with telling Si about how his appointment as Celtic captain came about following Neil Lennon's departure from the club.

With the armband came big responsibility as he reflects on his first season as captain as the team had to haul back a massive points deficit in the last few games of the 07-08 season to clinch their 3rd title in a row and Stephen's first as skipper.

Stephen also reflects on the more difficult times at Celtic including Gordon Strachan's disappointing last season and the introduction of Tony Mowbray which saw him out the door of his boyhood club.

From there, the boys discuss the rest of Stephen's career down south with Middlesbrough and back up the road with Motherwell where he was apart of a mighty battle to stay in the top division when a relegation play-off was on the cards against old rivals Rangers.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Garry O'Connor - Hibs, Russia, Birmingham & 2nd Chance Academy
snippet.description:
Si Ferry sits down with former Hibs strikers Garry O'Connor as he talks us through the rollercoaster of his extremely eventful footballing career.

From breaking through with Hibs' golden generation to getting a big money move to Lokomotiv Moscow and returning to Britain to play for Birmingham city, the big man doesn't pull any punches in this candid reflection of the goal scorer's career.

snippet.title: The Coaching Sessions - Scottish Youth Football
snippet.description:
Introducing a new feature to Open Goal, 'The Coaching Sessions' - a productive panel discussion on a variety of different aspects on modern coaching. 

Our debut episode is centred around Youth Football with our expert panel made up by current Rangers youth coach and leader of his own academy, Kevin Thomson; former Celtic and Arsenal striker and current first team coach at Livingston, John Hartson; our very own Si Ferry who also provides coaching to Celtic's Under 9s & 10s and finally Brian McLaughlin who is the current Scotland U18s boss. 

Brought to you by Intelligent Car Leasing - www.intelligentcarleasing.com

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Ally McCoist
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

Si Ferry sits down with Rangers all time top goal scorer and former manager, Ally McCoist for a entertaining look back on his career as a player, coach and brief acting days!

From 9 in a row, to coaching Scotland and becoming manager of his boyhood team during the club's most turbulent years, McCoist gives a brilliant and funny insight into some of the key moments from his career and the characters he's met and shared a dressing room with down the years.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Marvin Andrews Ep 2 - Rangers, 'Keep Believing', Helicopter Sunday, World Cup 2006
snippet.description:
In Episode 2 with Marvin Andrews, the big centre half talks us through his rollercoaster time with Rangers where he had to prove doubters he was good enough to be there, overcome a ligament injury through faith healing and restore the faith of his fans' and teammates that they could still win the 2005 League Title in the year of Helicopter Sunday.

He also discusses his pride of assisting his nation, Trinidad and Tobago to qualify for the 2006 World Cup which was a feat he never dreamed possible when first beginning his football career.

A truly incredible story that every football fan won't want to miss!

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... Marvin Andrews Ep 1 - Trinidad to Scotland, Raith Rovers, Livi, Rangers
snippet.description:
In part 1, Si sits down with the happiest man in Scotland, Marvin Andrews! The big man talks through his football education in Trinidad and the fascinating story which led him to land in Scotland and try to make it as a professional footballer.

He chats through the difficulties in adapting to the Scottish weather and culture as he went through trials at various clubs before ending up at Raith Rovers.

Marvin also delves into the highs and lows at Livingston from finishing 3rd in the top league to the club's financial oblivion which saw a number of peculiar incidents occur towards the end of his time there.

And of course the lads touch on his move to Rangers and how it all came about.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets... John Hartson Ep 1 - Arsenal, West Ham, Crazy Gang, Rangers Medical, Joining Celtic
snippet.description:
In Episode 1 of our 2-part series with Wales international, John Hartson, the big man talks us through the ups and downs of his career down south prior to his move to Celtic.

A man who broke many a transfer record, he talks Si through starting out at Luton which led to his big move to Arsenal where he tells us all about playing with big characters like Ian Wright, Tony Adams and Martin Keown as well as learning under George Graham and Arsene Wenger.

He then talks about his highs and lows with West Ham where he finished 2nd top goalscorer in England but had his time slightly marred by a training ground scrap with Eyal Berkovic which John talks about openly. 

On top of that, there are some great tales about his time with the Crazy Gang at Wimbledon and also at Coventry before getting into the details of his move to Celtic and his early days there, which of course arrived after a failed medical with arch-rivals Rangers.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Charlie Miller - Making it at Rangers, Gazza, 9 in a Row, Dundee United, Abroad
snippet.description:
Former Rangers and Dundee United midfielder, Charlie Miller sits down with Si to discuss his football career which saw him work with a plethora of the game's biggest characters including Gazza, Ally McCoist and Walter Smith.

Charlie provides an entertaining insight into his rollercoaster career from the highs of setting up Brian Laudrup's winner to seal 9 in a Row to his disappointing departure from Ibrox. 

He also discusses his career thereafter which included moves abroad to Norway, Belgium and Australia along with four enjoyable years back home with Dundee United.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Alex Rae - Falkirk, Millwall, Sunderland, Wolves & Return to Rangers
snippet.description:
Alex Rae sits down with Si Ferry to discuss the ups and downs and many funny moments from this thoroughly entertaining interview with the ex-Rangers man.

He chats us through his early release from his boyhood club as a youth player and his proceeding moves to the likes of Falkirk, Millwall, Sunderland and Wolves with some great tales about his former teammates including Teddy Sheringham, Nial Quinn and Paul Ince.

The conversation then moves onto his dream return to Rangers and the experiences of winning the league on a dramatic final day in 2005 and what it was like back living in Glasgow's goldfish bowl.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Tony Watt - Dream Celtic Debut, Playing with Idols, Barca Goal, The Future
snippet.description:
Si Ferry gets a blether with Scotland internationalist and former Celtic and Hearts striker, Tony Watt.

In a very open and honest interview, Tony talks about the many highs experienced in his career so far including his debut for Celtic, playing with and under some of his idols and of course his famous winner against Barcelona in the Champions league.

He also discusses some of the challenges he's faced in his time as a professional and his plans for the future as he looks to get back to playing regular football again in order to make the most of his gifted talent.

celtic barcelona you'll never walk alone

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Alan Stubbs Ep 2 - John Barnes at Celtic, Cancer scare, Everton & Hibs Scottish Cup
snippet.description:
In Part 2 of our chat with Alan Stubbs, the defender discusses the latter end of his Celtic career which saw frequent managerial changes between Dr Jo Venglos to John Barnes and Martin O'Neill.  

Alan also provides a detailed insight into the difficulties he experienced during that time period after being diagnosed with cancer and tells us the full story of how he managed to fight his way back to full health to play professional football again.

The chat then moves onto his move back to his boyhood club, Everton as he talks us through some of the characters he played with including Gazza, Wayne Rooney and Open Goal favourite, Tommy Gravesen!

Finally, we take time to focus on his reign as Manager of Hibs which saw him navigate the club to the most famous victory in their history as they won the William Hill Scottish Cup for the first time in 114 years.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Alan Stubbs Episode 1 - Early Celtic Days with the 3 Amigos, Stopping the 10
snippet.description:
Si Ferry sits down with a man who played a vital role in a defining era for Celtic as they began to challenge for Scotland's top honours again and managed to stop rival Rangers from winning 10 League Titles in a row. 

In Part 1, Alan Stubbs talks us through those early years at Celtic and gives us an excellent insight into the characters he shared a dressing room with including Paolo Di Canio, Pierre Van Hooijdonk, Henrik Larsson, Tommy Johnson and many more as well as providing thorough detail into the iconic season when Celtic stopped the 10 in 1998.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Arthur Numan Episode 2 - Rangers career, 2003 Title Race, Emotional Retirement
snippet.description:
In Part 2 of our interview with Rangers legend, Arthur Numan, the Dutchman gives Si a thorough insight into his Rangers career from beginning to end. 

He discusses the surreal experience of sitting in with the fans when Rangers clinched the title at Celtic Park in a dramatic game which involved referee Hugh Dallas being struck by a coin. 

The chat also goes into Arthur's regrets over the club's European performances during his time as well as how he felt during the transition from his mentor Advocaat's reign to Alex McLeish taking over as Manger which led to a fitting farewell for Arthur as the club achieved a treble in his final season which included a dramatic final day title race with Celtic.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Kolo Toure Episode 2 - Man City, Liverpool & Celtic Invincibles
snippet.description:
In part 2 of our chat with Kolo, the Ivorian discusses his move from Arsenal to Manchester City and his motives behind the transfer. 

He tells Si of his experiences with the managers he played under at the club as well as the players as the club were transitioning from a middle of the road team to Premier League winners.

Kolo also speaks fondly of his time at Liverpool where he first met Brendan Rodgers and reflects on the season they came agonisingly close to winning the title for the club.

He also speaks about his recent move to Celtic and how he was determined to prove doubters wrong that the club could replicate his achievements at Arsenal and go the full season unbeaten.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Kolo Toure Episode 1 - Football in Africa, Arsenal Invincibles, UCL Final
snippet.description:
We welcome a big name to our first show of the year with double Premier League winning and Ivory Coast internationalist, Kolo Toure sitting down with Si Ferry to chat through his career.

In the first of our two-part series with the Ivorian, we are given a fascinating insight into the football education Kolo received from his local academy which brought through the likes of his brother YaYa, Gervinho, Zakora and many others.

He tells Simon about transitioning into the Premier League during his early days at Arsenal and the support he received from the more senior pros in the team at the time.

Such support aided him in becoming a vital component of the Arsenal Invincibles team which managed to win the Premier League without losing a single game the entire season. Kolo gives Si an insight into the qualities of that team and what made them such a top team.

Kolo also discusses his remaining time at Arsenal which included the Champions League in 2006 as well as what led to his departure from a club he could never see himself leaving.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Kris Commons Episode 2 - UCL Last 16, POTY, Ronny Deila, Hibs & leaving Celtic
snippet.description:
In the 2nd episode of our 2 part series with Kris Commons, the boys discuss Celtic's 2012/13 Champions League campaign with Kris providing his insight into an incredible group stage which saw Celtic qualify for the Last 16 of the competition following a famous win over Barcelona.

Kris then chats about his Player of the Year form the following season and how much of an influence Neil Lennon was in helping him get the best out of his abilities while also disclosing the reason why he chose to retire from the Scotland National Team around that time.

His rocky relationship with former Manager, Ronny Deila is also brought up in which Kris gives a detailed insight into the breakdown of the relationship and the factors which led to the difficulties that occurred, including that stormy night in Norway.

The chat rounds up with a reflection on the last couple of years of Kris' career which saw the introduction of Brendan Rodgers as Celtic Manager as well as an enjoyable loan move to Hibs, while reiterating that the creative forward still might plan on sticking the boots on once more.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Kris Commons Episode 1 - Youth Football, Forest, Derby, 1st Season at Celtic
snippet.description:
In Episode 1 of our 2 part series with the former Celtic talisman, Kris Commons, we delve into the goal Scorer’s football upbringing down south and the path which led him to start making a name for himself with Nottignham Forest and Derby.

Kris shares some great stories from his days with the East Midlands clubs including some unorthodox approaches from his old managers towards pre season and contract negotiations!
The conversation moves on to Kris’ transfer to Celtic where there was no rest for the wicked as he was threw in as one of the main men in the team as Neil Lennon’s Celtic were in the hunt for the league title.

He tells Si about some of the surreal experiences he immediately faced in his first season including pivotal games against Rangers, a tense title race as well as the horrendous threatening incidents towards his manager, Neil Lennon.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Lee McCulloch Episode 2 - Administration, Rangers Captaincy, Departure, Killie Job
snippet.description:
The 2nd half of our chat with Lee McCulloch begins with the utility man discussing the variety of positions he found himself playing in for Rangers. Some more preferable than others.

Lee then provides a player's view insight into the club falling into administration and the difficulties that occurred for the squad during a tense period.

As such, he found himself playing in a different environment in amongst the lower leagues as Rangers had to climb their way up to the top division, in which he tells Si about those experiences and the different type of challenge that faced the team.

Lee also goes into detail about the pride he felt in being asked to become the captain of the club he always supported as a boy and the enhanced level of expectation and pressure which comes with that.

We also cover Lee's departure from Ibrox as well as his foray into football management with Kilmarnock and what plans lie ahead for him.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Lee McCulloch Ep 1 - Motherwell, Wigan, Moving to Rangers, UEFA Cup Final
snippet.description:
Si Ferry sits down with former Rangers captain, Lee McCulloch to discuss his career which saw him play for his local team, move to the Premier League and also the live the dream by playing for his boyhood club.

Lee discusses the hard education he experienced coming through the youth ranks at Motherwell, enduring a loan spell at Cumbernauld United and going on to share a first team dressing room with some of his fellow old school professionals at the Lanarkshire club.

The utility man recalls some fond memories from his time playing with Wigan in both the lower divisions in England and the Premier League as well as recounting a couple of stories from the characters he played with including the Bulldog, Jimmy Bullard.

The boys also talk about the early days of his dream move to Rangers and the pressure that comes with the expectations of playing for the club you support and how reaching the UEFA Cup Final helped win over the supporters in his favour.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Frank McAvennie Episode 2 - Celtic Centenary, The Fight at Ibrox, World Cup '86
snippet.description:
Part 2 of our chat with Frank kicks off with the discussion on his pivotal role in one of Celtic's most iconic season's in their history, the Centenary Year.

Frank reflects on the key moments of that season including a fight at Ibrox which saw him and 3 Rangers players ending up in court as a result of the incident, as well as the cup final itself where it was his late brace which saw the club secure the double in its 100th Anniversary.

He tells Si about how Graeme Souness tried to buy him for Rangers at the time the club signed ex-Celtic player Mo Johnston and explains the reasons why he couldn't do it.

He also looks back on his disappointing 2nd spells at both clubs as well as talking through his experiences of going to a World Cup with Scotland back in Mexico 1986.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Frank McAvennie Episode 1 - Making it Late at St Mirren, West Ham, London & Celtic
snippet.description:
Si Ferry sits down with one of British football's biggest personalities, Frank McAvennie. In part 1 of our 2 part interview with the West Ham and Celtic cult icon, Frank discusses his early football upbringing growing up in the Milton and sacrificing his football to go watch his beloved Celtic every week. 

A late developer to the professional game, he talks through his quick ascension up the footballing ranks from getting his start at St Mirren to moving down south with West Ham during a period which saw them become agonisingly close to securing the First Division title.

No interview would be complete of course without getting a word from Frank on the London nightlife he enjoyed as he tells us how his life changed overnight after he appeared on the talkshow 'Wogan' which saw him claim instant celebrity status.

He also discusses how the boy from the stands ended up living the dream after moving to Celtic to play under his idol Billy McNeill. A moment of pride for both him and his family.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...James McFadden Episode 3 - Scotland Interview Special
snippet.description:
In the final episode of our three-part series, James chats with Si about his Scotland career which saw him become one of the country's top performers during his era.

He discusses each of the different managers he would play under with Scotland and the big moments which occurred during each of those regimes.  

James goes into detail on the highs and lows that he experienced during his Scotland career from scoring against the world's top teams to disappointingly being frozen out by Craig Levein.

A very entertaining, open and honest chat with one of Scotland's most iconic players in recent times.
tags: James McFadden goal against France commentary

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...James McFadden Episode 2 - Everton Days, Birmingham & Return to Scotland
snippet.description:
In part 2 of our sit-down chat with James McFadden, the playmaker reminisces about his days with Everton after signing under fellow Scot, David Moyes.

He discusses how he adapted as a young boy moving away from home for the first time to settle in at the club as well as providing an insight into some of the colourful characters he used to play with including Tommy Gravesen and Duncan Ferguson.

McFadden also discusses his time away from Everton, signing for Birmingham City which ultimately saw him return to the Merseyside club following a frustrating spell of injuries in the Midlands.

Now back playing in his native Scotland, he speaks to Si about his plans for the future when he decides to hang up his boots.
tags: james mcfadden goal against france commentary

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...James McFadden Episode 1 - Making it at Motherwell, Standing out, Celtic interest
snippet.description:
Episode 1 of our 3 part series with James McFadden takes us right back to the start with the forward chatting to Si about his working class background and how that environment allowed him to develop his creative style of play and gave him his gallus approach to taking senior football head on.

He recalls some great stories from his time breaking through at Motherwell and discusses the benefit it gave him in bringing on his game at a young age compared to coming through at either of the Celtic or Rangers academies.

The boys also talk about his departure from Motherwell and how close a move to boyhood heroes Celtic actually came before he left for Everton in the Premier League.
tags: james mcfadden goal against france commentary

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Barry Ferguson Ep 3 - UEFA Cup, Scotland/Burley Boozegate, Birmingham, Clyde
snippet.description:
In our final instalment with Barry Ferguson, the Scotland international takes us through the recovery from Paul Le Guen's departure with Walter Smith returning as Manager and bringing success back to the club.

That success includes Rangers run to the UEFA Cup Final in 2008 which Barry looks back fondly on despite the regret of the team not doing themselves justice in the end.

The conversation moves on to the infamous Scotland camp under George Burley, labeled 'Boozegate' which led to the end of Barry's Scotland and ultimately Rangers career.  He talks openly and frank to Si about his perspective on the situation and what exactly happened over those few days.

The midfielder wraps up our chat by looking back on his time with Birmingham where he clinched a League Cup winners medal versus Arsenal as well as discussing his plans to get into coaching following his stint with lower league, Clyde.
tags: barry ferguson free kick v celtic

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Barry Ferguson Episode 2 - Treble, Moving to Blackburn, Rangers Return, PLG
snippet.description:
In our 2nd instalment with Barry Ferguson, the former Scotland skipper opens up on how over celebrating Rangers' 2003 league win nearly cost them the Scottish Cup Final the following week.

He gives Si the details on how his move to Blackburn came about, his experiences with Souness and the Premier League as well as why he was desperate to get back to Rangers as soon as he made the move.

Barry goes on to give an incredible insight into the Paul Le Guen era at Rangers which saw him banished by the Frenchman during a tumultuous time at Ibrox.
tags: barry ferguson free kick v celtic

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Barry Ferguson Episode 1 - Rangers Education, Breaking into 1st Team, Captaincy
snippet.description:
In the first instalment of our Barry Ferguson series, we sit down with one of Rangers' most decorated players to talk through what has been a rollercoaster career.

Barry talks Si through his early days at the club and how a tough but fair education from the likes of John Brown, Gazza and Laudrup influenced his strong mentality when going on to play for the Rangers first team.

He also discusses the big moments that occurred during a period which saw him become one of the top players in the country and handed the captaincy as a young man in a dressing room full of experienced internationals.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Scott McDonald Ep 5 - Boro under Strachan, Unexpected Mowbray Reunion, The Future
snippet.description:
In our final episode, Scott reflects on his time with Middlesbrough and discusses what he thinks went wrong during Gordon Strachan's time there.

The boys also have a laugh about Scott being unexpectedly reunited with Tony Mowbray who he had a strained relationship with at Celtic while also looking at the difference in intensity between the English Championship and playing for Celtic.

Plenty of other chat including how he's enjoying Dundee United and also his plans for the future after football.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Scott McDonald Ep 4 - 'Fluffing' 4IAR, Stormy times with Mowbray, Celtic exit
snippet.description:
In a must see 4th instatment of our series, Scott gives a phenomenal insight into the last couple of years of his Celtic career including his disappointment in losing the chance to win 4 in a row with Celtic which resulted in Gordon Strachan's exit.

He is also gives a rarely heard insight into his stormy relationship with Tony Mowbray and how he felt he was being singled out by the manager and pushed towards the exit door.

localized.title: Si Ferry Meets...Scott McDonald Ep 4 - 'Fluffing' 4IAR, Stormy times with Mowbray, Celtic exit
localized.description:
In a must see 4th instatment of our series, Scott gives a phenomenal insight into the last couple of years of his Celtic career including his disappointment in losing the chance to win 4 in a row with Celtic which resulted in Gordon Strachan's exit.

He is also gives a rarely heard insight into his stormy relationship with Tony Mowbray and how he felt he was being singled out by the manager and pushed towards the exit door.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Scott McDonald Ep 3 - Scoring against AC Milan, beating Rangers to the title in '08
snippet.description:
Scott McDonald relives his glory days with Celtic and looks back at the famous European nights he enjoyed with the club including scoring the winner against the reigning European Champions AC Milan.

He also recalls the highlight of his career in winning the league title at Tannadice in 2008 following a Herculean comeback in the last 7 games of the season which involved two massive matches against rivals Rangers.

WATCH EPISODE 1 HERE: https://youtu.be/zTKpmlcTXAA

WATCH EPISODE 2 HERE: https://youtu.be/jwUDqAIXfFY
tags: Si Ferry Meets...Scott McDonald Ep 3 - Scoring against AC Milan
beating Rangers to the title in '08

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Scott McDonald Ep 2 - Helicopter Sunday, Rangers Bid, Celtic & Gordon Strachan
snippet.description:
The elephant in the room is addressed in Episode 2 as Scott gives his insight into Helicopter Sunday and what his immediate thoughts were following the game including which teammate managed to pick him up out of the chaos.

The boys also go on to chat about the bid that was received by Rangers for Scott and what his views were on a potential move to Ibrox.  

However, he goes on to beam about his dream move to Celtic Park and discusses the start to his career with the Hoops as well as the excellent education he received under Gordon Strachan.

Watch Episode 1 here: https://youtu.be/zTKpmlcTXAA

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Scott McDonald Ep 1 - Growing up a Celtic fan, Southampton, 'Mental' Motherwell
snippet.description:
In our first of five instalments with one of Scottish Football's most lethal strikers, Scott chats with Simon on his footballing upbringing in Australia which saw him catch the bug of Celtic early on through his Scottish family lineage.

He delves into first moving over to the UK and winning a contract with Southampton where he would play with the likes of Premier League legend Matt Le Tissier and eventually be managed and let go by his future Celtic manager Gordon Strachan.

This departure then leads to his move to Motherwell, where the boys have a laugh about the colourful characters that he shared a dressing room with and the chaotic culture that was present under manager Terry Butcher at the time.

WATCH EPISODE 2 HERE: https://youtu.be/jwUDqAIXfFY

WATCH EPISODE 3 HERE: https://youtu.be/bzxVUSAs-HM
tags: Si Ferry Meets...Scott McDonald Ep 1 - Growing up a Celtic fan

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Kris Boyd Episode 5 - Back to Killie, Disastrous 2nd spell at Rangers & the future
snippet.description:
In our final instalment, Kris talks to Si about his return to Scotland following his time abroad and how he felt disillusioned with the game until his 2nd spell with Kilmarnock reignited his passion again.

He also goes on to discuss his return to Rangers during a controversial period for the club which saw them fail to achieve promotion from the Scottish Championship.  A 'Disaster' by all accounts according to Boyd.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Kris Boyd Episode 4 - Madness in Turkey, Portland Timbers in the MLS
snippet.description:
Kris talks about his bizarre experiences in Turkey following his move to Eskişehirspor with incidents ranging from his Manager ending up in jail, football corruption and men in black suits turning up to training looking for him!

He also discusses his mixed experience on the playing side after he moved to Portland Timbers but raves about the set up of the MLS as he predicts a big future for the league in the coming years.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Kris Boyd Episode 3 - Leaving Rangers, Scotland Retirement, Boro, Forest
snippet.description:
The lads open Episode 3 discussing the motives behind Kris finally calling it a day with Rangers after his first spell with the club.  

Si raises the subject of Scotland and why the striker chose to retire under George Burley with the reasons not necessarily related to the public perception of the decision.

The chat also takes a slight tonal shift as Kris opens up about the difficulties footballers can sometimes experience when moving clubs which he could relate to following his ill fated move to Middlesbrough.

Kris takes time however to give his analysis on what went wrong for Gordon Strachan at Boro and also talks about his positive experience playing for Nottingham Forest on loan under Manager Billy Davies.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Kris Boyd Episode 2 - PLG Exit, Walter Smith, Role for Gers and SPL Goal Record
snippet.description:
In our 2nd instalment with Kris Boyd, the striker outlines his thoughts on why Paul Le Guen really stripped Barry Ferguson of the Rangers captaincy prior to his exit from Ibrox.

He discusses the dramatic change in form and culture Walter Smith had on the club which led to their many successes under the Manager with Kris' role as domestic goalscorer being emphasised by the gaffer.

Kris also pays a poignant tribute to Fernando Ricksen as well as expressing his pride on breaking the all time SPL goal record ahead of Henrik Larsson.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Kris Boyd Episode 1 - Kilmarnock Education, Move to Rangers, Problems under Le Guen
snippet.description:
Kicking off our new series with the SPL’s record goal-scorer, Kris sits down with Si and talks about his tough football upbringing involving constantly testing himself against older and more physically intimidating players to ensure he could progress as quickly as possible.

He discusses his first spell with Kilmarnock and who the biggest influencers were at the club which led to his goal-scoring grabbing the attention of clubs down South as well as his boyhood heroes Rangers.

Kris also talks Simon through his early days at Ibrox along with the warning signs that were apparent when Frenchman Paul Le Guen took over from the man that signed him, Alex McLeish.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Aiden McGeady Episode 5 - Moving to Everton & loans to Sheff Wed & Preston
snippet.description:
In our final episode with Aiden, he discusses finally getting his dream move to the Premier League after departing Spartak Moscow from Everton.

He tells Si about his rocky relationship with Martinez which saw him not get as much game time as he would've liked and led to the winger going out on loan.

From there he talks about the influence his new Sunderland Manager, Simon Grayson has had on his career and how he revived his form when feeling at his lowest point while playing football.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Aiden McGeady Episode 4 - Playing against Celtic, Life & (Crazy) Times in Russia
snippet.description:
In Episode 4, Aiden tells Si about transitioning to life in Russia when first moving over from Celtic. 

He talks about the occasion when Spartak were drawn against his boyhood cub in the Champions League and how he felt going back to Celtic Park.

Aiden also goes into detail about some of the bizarre experiences he saw while over in Moscow and the differences in attitude and culture towards football in the country.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Aiden McGeady Episode 3 - 2007 - 2010 Celtic years, Leaving for Russia
snippet.description:
The boys kick off Episode 3 discussing Celtic's dramatic comeback to win the title in 2008 which involved 2 tense games against Rangers and a fight with Nacho Novo!

Aiden pays an emotional tribute to one of the biggest influences in his career, Tommy Burns following his passing that same season.  

They discuss the season Tony Mowbray took charge and what went wrong under his regime before chatting through Aiden's departure from his boyhood club to move to Spartak Moscow in Russia.

snippet.description:
In Episode 2, Aiden talks about cementing himself as a first-team Celtic player while having a strained relationship with the manager Gordon Strachan.

He also talks about some of the brilliant characters he played with including the enigmatic Tommy Gravesen as well as discussing his experiences when it came to playing in football's top stage, the Champions League.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Aiden McGeady Episode 1 - Celtic education, making an impact in the 1st team
snippet.description:
We bring you our bumper first episode with Aiden McGeady where he sits down with Si and discusses the hard but fair education he received at Celtic as they tried to hone his evident talent.

They have a laugh about some of the tough characters they had to deal with when breaking into the first team and also some of the key games that set Aiden up to become one of the Celtic's most vital players over the coming years.

snippet.description:

He tells Si about the evident differences he experienced between foreign dressing rooms and the ones he was used to at home as well as the general changes in cultural approach to preparing and playing game.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Darren O'Dea Episode 3 - Mowbray Era, Roy Keane's wrath & Loan Spells
snippet.description:
In Episode 3, the lads look back on Tony Mowbray's era at Celtic and the factors involved which led to an unsuccessful tenure.

Darren reflects on his experiences with football legend Roy Keane both as a player and manager and details how no one escaped his wrath...including people that weren't even in the room!

Si also asks Darren about his loan spells away from Celtic where he experienced both good times and bad when venturing down south.

snippet.description:

snippet.description:

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Charlie Adam Episode 2 - Walter Smith, UEFA Cup Final, Blackpool and the EPL
snippet.description:
In Episode 2, Charlie discusses the impact of Walter Smith's arrival at Ibrox and how despite reaching a European Final with the new gaffer, he knew his own time was up at Rangers.

He also gives Si an insight into his extremely successful spell with Blackpool which saw him top many Premier League team's transfer wish lists. He talks about the off-the-cuff approach Blackpool had to Premier League games and what made the team do so well in getting to England's top division.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Darren O'Dea Episode 1 - Brilliant Chris Sutton wind up stories & Tommy Burns
snippet.description:
In our first episode with Darren, he discusses the differences in youth football culture between his upbringing and that of today's.

He reminisces on the brilliance of Tommy Burns in developing him as a player, highlighting his stern side as well as his humorous one.

He also tells Simon some hilarious anecdotes of when the big characters of the first team used to stitch him up as a youth player...Chris Sutton being the main culprit!

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Charlie Adam Episode 1 - School of Hard Knocks at Ibrox, Le Guen era
snippet.description:
In our first episode with English Premier League midfielder, Charlie Adam, he discusses the importance of his early loan spells in preparing him for first team football at Rangers.

Charlie gives a fantastic insight into the Paul Le Guen era at Rangers which saw him get his break into the first team but ended in drama and controversy with the Frenchman's departure.

He details the difficulty of breaking through as a young player at Ibrox with the big characters and high expectations that are set when training with the first team.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Kevin Thomson Episode 7 - Near Move to Spain & Fairytale Finish with Hibs
snippet.description:
In our final episode with Kevin Thomson, he reveals how close he came to sealing a move to Spain to see out his career but with the deal falling through at the last minute.

However, all was well after he was able to sample a fairytale finish to his professional career by being part of the squad of his hometown team when they achieved their greatest feat in winning the Scottish Cup for the first time 114 years.

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Charlie Mulgrew Episode 4 - Ronny Deila, the Initial Success and What Went Wrong
snippet.description:
In Episode 4, Charlie gives a rare insight into the arrival of Ronny Deila at Celtic following Neil Lennon's departure.  

He opens up on the changes Ronny implemented at the club including the squad diet and how the players reacted to it.  

Despite a successful first season at the club, Charlie reveals what he think perhaps went wrong the following year which led to the Norwegian's departure.  

Not to be missed!

snippet.title: Si Ferry Meets...Charlie Mulgrew Episode 3 - POTY, Beating Barca & Pressure of Winning at Celtic
snippet.description:
Part 3 - Charlie speaks to Si about finally cementing himself in the Celtic first team in his 2nd season since his return to the club which included a run of form that saw him crowned Scotland's Player of the Year.

He also discusses the experience of being involved in one of the most famous victories in the club's history, Celtic's 2-1 defeat of Barcelona. Did they really believe they could win?

With great success also comes heightened expectations. Charlie details the pressures that Celtic teams face after setting themselves such high standards to maintain.

snippet.title: LEWIS MACLEOD | Former Rangers Midfielder Joins Us On Keeping The Ball On The Ground
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

This week, we're delighted to be joined by a special guest with former Rangers midfielder, Lewis MacLeod making his debut appearance on the show!

Lewis chats candidly about his career so far which has been paused temporarily due to injury. He discusses coming through the youth ranks at Ibrox, breaking into the 1st team under Ally McCoist during a tumultuous time at the club and his much talked-about departure from Rangers when he was sold to Brentford for £1 million.

The lads also analyse the weekend's action with Celtic extending their lead to 3 points at the top-of-the-league after Rangers dropped points against Dundee United at Tannadice and we discuss the most recent managerial appointments at Aberdeen, Dundee & St Mirren.

#RangersFC #SPFL #Podcast

This week we're buzzing to bring another huge name onto the show as Si and Slaney sit down with one of the best defenders the Premier League has seen, Jonathan Woodgate!

He takes us through the highs and lows of his careers in a candid chat about coming through at Leeds during an exciting era in the early 2000s as the competed at the top end of the Premier League and Europe.

Following the Leeds' financial troubles, we also discuss Jonathan's move to Newcastle United where he played under Bobby Robson and alongside big characters such as Alan Shearer and Craig Bellamy.

And of course, he also discusses the Real Madrid full Real Madrid experience from the surreal nature of the move happening, the teammates, the injury struggles and the debut.

An amazing chat with a great guy and brilliant player, make sure you don't miss it!

snippet.title: SHAY GIVEN | Open Goal Meets... Newcastle, Ireland & Premier League Legend
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Open Goal - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R

The interviews are back and we've got an absolute legend to kick-off the series as Si Ferry & Slaney sit down with former Newcastle United, Man City & Ireland goalkeeper Shay Given!

The candid chat with Ireland's record caps-holder for a goalie goes back to his early career at Celtic where he discusses how the club let him slip through the net during a turbulent time in the East End of Glasgow, to his time with Kenny Dalglish at Blackburn and Newcastle and all the amazing moments and memories he experienced from his time at St James' Park both in the Premier League and in Europe.

We of course also chat about his time with Man City at the start of the Sheik Mansour revolution as well as his historic moments and funniest teammate stories with the National Team including the 2002 World Cup, Thierry Henry's Hand Ball and Euro 2012.

#NewcastleUnited #ManCity #Ireland

snippet.title: KYOGO FURUHASHI GOALS & DUNDEE UTD BEAT RANGERS TO END UNBEATEN RUN | Keeping The Ball On The Ground
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R​

The SPFL Premiership has been on one since it returned last week with another explosive weekend as Dundee United shocked everyone by beating Rangers at Tannadice to bring their unbeaten run of 41 league games to an end.

St Johnstone continue to upset the odds as we discuss their unbelievable result away from against Galatasary in the Europa League as well as chat about the chances the other Scottish teams have of progressing in Europe this week.

Andy Halliday also chats us through another win and another goal for him as the feel good factor continues for Hearts, Hibs and Aberdeen with all 3 sitting joint-top of the league.

And OF COURSE we'll be giving our view on the news everyone in world football is talking about - Lionel Messi leaving Barcelona!

#Football #Podcast #SPFL

snippet.title: THE ACCIES ARE DOWN! Right in the Coupon w/ Who Knows Wins
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Open Goal - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R​​​​

It has finally happened! Hamilton Accies look all but certain to be relegated from the Scottish Premiership after years of bravely defying the odds and avoiding the drop to the Championship. Derek reacts to his 2nd favourite team's relegation and the boys discuss who might join them as the play-off place goes down to the wire between Kilmarnock and Ross County this weekend.

The lads also praise Hibs and Jack Ross after the men from Leith secured 3rd place, discuss Rangers forthcoming trophy day at Ibrox as well as Scott Brown's last game at Celtic Park and whether Karamoko Dembele could be the new star of the future for the club.

snippet.title: RANGERS DELIVER FINAL BLOW TO CELTIC'S SEASON | Keeping The Ball On The Ground
snippet.description:
👕🚚 Like the clobber on the show? FREE Next Day Delivery with Code 'OPENGOAL' with our sponsors Pretty Green ➡️ www.prettygreen.com
Terms & Conditions apply*

SUBSCRIBE to Open Goal - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R​​​

Rangers were rampant against rivals Celtic as they ran out 4-1 winners at Ibrox in their final game of the season against each other. The boys look back at the game and discuss what impact the heavy victory will have on next season as well as chat about the relegation battle that took a further twist at the weekend.

The lads also discuss Player of the Year candidates, the news that 26 players will now be called up for the Euros squad, Marcelo's bizarre reason for potentially missing the Champions League Semi Final and the scenes at Old Trafford at the weekend which lead to Man Utd vs Liverpool getting cancelled.

snippet.title: JACKSON IRVINE | Open Goal Meets... Hibs & Oz Midfielder talks Celtic, Hull, County League Cup Win
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Open Goal - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R​​

This week we're delighted to be joined by Slaney's old teammate, Jackson Irvine who takes a trip back down memory lane as they discuss their Celtic youth days and their experiences getting in amongst and playing in the 1st team under Neil Lennon.

Jackson then gives us some great stories from dressing rooms he's played in with the likes of Ross County where he won the League Cup, Hully City and Burton Albion with Nigel Clough.

The Australian of course also fills us in on his World Cup experience in 2018, playing against eventual winners France and gives us an insight into what life at Hibs has been like for him this season.

snippet.title: SUPER LEAGUE REACTION & RANGERS BEAT CELTIC | Keeping the Ball on the Ground
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R​​

It's been an incredible and monumental few days in the world of football as the controversial Super League was introduced and taken down after supporters around the world united in their anger and disgust at the plans. The boys discuss the damaging nature of the concept and the lessons that should be learned for the whole of football going forward.

We of course also look at domestic matters as we look back on another Rangers victory over Celtic as well as get an insight from Kev on his day out at Stranraer covering the game against Hibs for the BBC!

snippet.title: MARVIN BARTLEY | Open Goal Meets...
snippet.description:
SUBSCRIBE - https://bit.ly/2QGY26R​​​

This week we've got an epic chat with current Livingston and former Hibs, Burnley, Bournemouth and Leyton Orient midfielder, Marvin Bartley.

Marvin recalls loads of brilliant funny stories from his days at Bournemouth and Burnley with manager Eddie Howe and goes into great detail on his eventful time at Hibs playing under the likes of Alan Stubbs and Neil Lennon during a period which saw the club famously win the Scottish Cup in a team that included top players and characters such as John McGinn, Jason Cummings, Anthony Stokes and Dylan McGeouch.

He also discusses his crazy stint at Leyton Orient which nearly made him quit football due to the unruly behaviour and interference from the club's foreign owner as well as tell the lads about the last couple of years at Livingston, Manager David Martindale and the recent League Cup Final loss to St Johnstone.

It's the first podcast of the year and we're joined by Special Guest, Barry Ferguson who helps us run through the main talking points from the big game at Ibrox which saw Rangers extend their lead over Celtic even further as they look to end their rivals' chances of 10 in a row.

We also discuss Stephen Robinson's departure from Motherwell, the Big Yogi effect up at Ross County, what's going on at Hibs and also reflect on the end of an era as Only An Excuse aired its final show last week.
